intro: Aegiphila punctata, commonly known as the dotted aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Aegiphila punctata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
